metadata.title: Live Activities and ActivityKit - Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Comprehensive Apple Developer documentation covering Live Activities and ActivityKit framework. Live Activities enable apps to display real-time, glanceable information across iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, Mac, and CarPlay. The documents detail the lifecycle, presentation styles, design guidelines, and implementation requirements for creating effective Live Activities.

overview.definition: Live Activities let people keep track of tasks and events in glanceable locations across devices. They go beyond push notifications, delivering frequent content and status updates over a few hours and letting people interact with the displayed information.
useCases: Food delivery order tracking with remaining time until arrival
Live in-game information for sports matches
Real-time fitness metrics with interactive controls to pause or cancel workouts
Rideshare tracking with driver details and ETA

Mac.notes: Active Live Activities automatically appear on paired Mac. Clicking launches iPhone Mirroring.

AppleWatch.notes: Appears at top of Smart Stack when Live Activity begins on iPhone

CarPlay.notes: Interactive elements are deactivated in CarPlay

overview.visionOSNote: Requests to start a Live Activity from a compatible iPad or iPhone app fail on visionOS.

compact.description: Used when only one Live Activity is active in the Dynamic Island. Consists of two separate elements: one on the leading side and one on the trailing side of the TrueDepth camera.
designGuidelines: Display dynamic, up-to-date information essential to the Live Activity
Design leading and trailing elements to read as a single piece of information
Use consistent color and typography to create connection between elements
Keep content as narrow as possible and snug against TrueDepth camera
Maintain balanced layout with similarly sized views for leading and trailing
Both elements should link to the same screen when tapped

minimal.description: Used when multiple Live Activities are active. One appears attached to Dynamic Island, one appears detached. Detached appears circular or oval depending on content size.
minimal.usage: Dynamic Island with multiple activities, StandBy on iPhone
designGuidelines: Ensure Live Activity is recognizable even in minimal form
Display updated information rather than just a logo when possible
Ensure people can quickly recognize your app

expanded.description: Displayed when people touch and hold a Live Activity in compact or minimal presentation.
expanded.usage: Touch and hold interaction in Dynamic Island
designGuidelines: Maintain relative placement of elements from compact/minimal for coherent layout transition
Wrap content tightly around TrueDepth camera
Avoid leaving too much room around the camera
Don't replicate notification layouts - create unique layout specific to your information

lockScreen.description: Banner displayed at bottom of Lock Screen. On devices without Dynamic Island, briefly appears as banner overlaying Home Screen or other apps for alerts.
lockScreen.usage: Lock Screen on iPhone and iPad
designGuidelines: Use layout similar to expanded presentation
Choose colors that work well on personalized Lock Screen
Use custom background/tint colors sparingly
Standard layout margin is 14 points
Verify design in Dark Mode and Always-On display
Verify generated dismiss button color matches your design

customization.backgroundColor: Can use custom background color (light background in light mode, dark in dark mode by default)

standBy.description: On iPhone in StandBy, Live Activity appears in minimal presentation. Tapping transitions to Lock Screen presentation scaled 2x to fill screen.
designGuidelines: Update layout for StandBy - ensure assets look great at larger scale
Consider creating custom layout for extra space
Consider using default background color for seamless blend with device bezel
Use standard margins - avoid extending graphics to screen edge
Verify design in Night Mode (red tint applied)
standBy.backgroundBehavior: If Lock Screen uses custom background color, system automatically extends it to whole screen

dynamicIsland.shapeNote: Rounded corner shape matches TrueDepth camera

timing: After user-initiated actions (food order, rideshare request)
When specific events begin (sports match starts)
Can start automatically at appropriate times
bestPractices: Start at appropriate times that match user expectations
Make it easy for people to turn off Live Activities in your app
Consider offering App Shortcut to start Live Activity (e.g., Action button)
Unexpected Live Activities can be surprising or unwanted
Update only when new content is available
Don't update if underlying content/status remains the same
Alert people only for essential updates requiring attention
Avoid alerting too often or with non-crucial updates
Don't use push notifications alongside Live Activities for same updates

alerts.behavior: Light up screen and play notification sound by default
alerts.presentation: Show expanded presentation in Dynamic Island or banner on non-Dynamic Island devices

multipleEvents.recommendation: Use single Live Activity with dynamic layout that rotates through events
multipleEvents.example: Sports app cycling through scored points, substitutions, and fouls across multiple matches

ending.timing: End immediately when task or event ends
ending.dynamicIslandBehavior: System immediately removes from Dynamic Island and CarPlay

customDismissal.recommendation: Set custom dismissal time proportional to Live Activity duration
customDismissal.typicalRange: 15-30 minutes is adequate in most cases
customDismissal.example: Rideshare app ends when ride completes, remains visible 30 minutes for ride summary and tip

duration.idealUseCase: Tasks and events with defined beginning and end

widgetIntegration.codeSharing: Can share code between widgets and Live Activities
widgetIntegration.differenceFromWidgets: Live Activities use ActivityKit push notifications instead of timeline mechanism

contentPrinciples: Focus on important information people need at a glance
Don't display everything - prioritize most useful information
Don't use for ads or promotions
Avoid displaying sensitive information - show innocuous summary instead
Let people tap to view sensitive information in app
Redact views with sensitive information; let people configure visibility

brandingAndIdentity: Match app's visual aesthetic and personality in dark and light appearances
If including logo mark, display without container
Use bold colors for text and objects to convey personality and brand
typography: Ensure text is easy to read
Use large, heavier-weight text (medium weight or higher)
Ensure key information is legible at a glance
layout: Adapt to different screen sizes and presentations
Create layouts and assets for various devices and scale factors
Adjust element size and placement for efficient space use
Use familiar layouts for custom views
Use templates with default system margins from Apple Design Resources
Keep content compact and snug within concentric margins
Use inset container shapes or thick lines to separate content blocks
Don't draw content all the way to Dynamic Island edge

margins.concentricPlacement: Use even, matching margins between rounded shapes and edges
margins.cornerRadiusMatching: Match inner corner radius by subtracting margin from outer radius
margins.swiftUIHelper: Use ContainerRelativeShape for correct corner radius

dynamicHeight.lockScreen: Change height based on available information
dynamicHeight.expanded: Reduce height when less information, increase when more available
dynamicHeight.example: Rideshare app compact while locating driver, extends with ETA and driver details

keyLine.description: Appears around Dynamic Island in dark backgrounds to distinguish from content
keyLine.customization: Tint to match your Live Activity content colors

animations.alwaysOnDisplayNote: System doesn't perform animations on Always-On displays with reduced luminance
bestPractices: Use animations to reinforce information and bring attention to updates
Animate position changes, scale, opacity, and movement
Animate layout changes - preserve existing layout during transitions
Animate existing elements to new positions rather than removing/re-adding
Use fade-in-and-out for non-moving list items when one item moves
animations.developerReference: Animating data updates in widgets and Live Activities

deepLinking.requirement: Tapping Live Activity must open app at right location
deepLinking.implementation: Use SwiftUI deep links to specific screens
deepLinking.reference: Linking to specific app scenes from your widget or Live Activity

useCases: Essential functionality directly related to Live Activity
Apps accessing microphone for live audio
limitations: Controls take space from useful information display
Prefer limiting to single interactive element
Helps avoid accidental wrong control taps
controls.responseToUpdates: Consider letting people respond to event/progress updates with button or toggle

appShortcuts.recommendation: Offer App Shortcut that starts your Live Activity
appShortcuts.example: Allow starting via Action button on iPhone

doNotDo: Don't add elements to app that draw attention to Dynamic Island
Don't display sensitive information without redaction option
Don't use push notifications alongside Live Activities for same updates

iPhone.designApproach: Start with iPhone design, then refine for other contexts

iPad.dimensions: Same as iPhone for Lock Screen

macOS.interaction: Clicking launches iPhone Mirroring to display app

watchOS.defaultView: Combines leading and trailing elements from compact presentation

tapBehavior.withoutWatchOSApp: Opens full-screen view with button to open app on paired iPhone

customLayout.recommendation: Create custom watchOS layout for more information and interactivity
customLayout.interactivity: Can include buttons or toggles in custom layout
customLayout.carPlayConsideration: Custom watchOS layout also applies to CarPlay where interactivity is disabled

carPlay.defaultView: Combines leading and trailing elements from compact presentation
carPlay.scalingNote: System may scale Live Activity to fit vehicle's screen size and resolution

interactivity.recommendation: Prefer displaying timely content rather than buttons/toggles if started while driving

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The documents begin with an overview of Live Activities and their cross-platform presence, then dive into the four required presentation styles. The lifecycle section covers when and how to start, update, and end activities. Design guidelines provide comprehensive visual and interaction guidance. Platform-specific sections give tailored advice for each Apple platform. The ActivityKit documentation provides the technical API reference. Both conclude with specifications, resources, and change history.

keyTerms.definition: A feature that lets people track tasks and events in glanceable locations across devices, delivering frequent content and status updates
The area around the TrueDepth camera on iPhone where Live Activities appear in compact, minimal, or expanded presentations
The framework used to configure, start, update, and end Live Activities
Two-element presentation used when single Live Activity is active, showing leading and trailing content around TrueDepth camera
Presentation used when multiple Live Activities are active, showing one attached and one detached from Dynamic Island
Full-size presentation shown when user touches and holds a compact or minimal Live Activity
Banner displayed at bottom of Lock Screen for Live Activities
iPhone mode where Live Activity appears in minimal presentation, transitioning to 2x scaled Lock Screen presentation on tap
Remote notifications that can start, update, and end Live Activities from a server
The location on Apple Watch where Live Activities appear
The camera system in Dynamic Island around which compact and expanded Live Activity content wraps
SwiftUI helper for applying correct corner radius matching the outer container

keyFindings: Live Activities must support four presentations: compact, minimal, expanded, and Lock Screen
Maximum recommended duration is 8 hours for Live Activities
Dynamic Island corner radius is 44 points
Standard Lock Screen margin is 14 points
Ended Live Activities persist on Lock Screen up to 4 hours but are immediately removed from Dynamic Island
Custom dismissal time of 15-30 minutes is typically adequate
Live Activities use ActivityKit push notifications instead of widget timeline mechanism
Interactive elements are deactivated in CarPlay
Custom watchOS layouts also apply to CarPlay
visionOS does not support Live Activities

technicalSpecifications.endedActivityPersistence: Up to 4 hours on Lock Screen, Mac menu bar, and watchOS Smart Stack

designDecisions.decision: Black opaque background for Dynamic Island
designDecisions.rationale: Cannot be customized; use bold colors for text and objects to stand out
System chooses presentation based on device and context; all must be supported

designDecisions.decision: Single Live Activity for multiple events
designDecisions.rationale: Prevents need to jump between separate activities; use dynamic layout that rotates through events
Prevents accidental wrong control taps and preserves space for information
Primary platform; refine for other contexts afterward
